org.bsc.bean
Class AbstractBeanManager<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.bsc.bean.AbstractBeanManager<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
BeanManager<T>
public abstract class AbstractBeanManager<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements BeanManager<T>

This class provides a skeletal implementation of the BeanManager interface to minimize the effort required to implement this interface. The only method that you need to implement is instantiateBean to customize the bean instance creation

Version:
2.2.1
Author:
BARTOLOMEO Sorrentino

store

public int store(java.sql.Connection conn,
                 T bean,
                 StoreConstraints constraints,
                 java.lang.String... properties)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
update bean into db having the possibility of include/exclude properties into update command 
 Ex.:

  int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, true, "prop1",  "prop2", ... ); // include

  OR

  int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, false, "prop1",  "prop2" ); // exclude

Specified by:
store in interface BeanManager<T>
Parameters:
conn - database connection
bean - object to update into db
properties - properties to include/exclude to update
constraints - allow to include or exclude properties from update
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

findById

public T findById(java.sql.Connection conn,
                  java.lang.Object... id)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
select bean from db using an primary key value Note: if you have a composite key must pass into id parameter a Object array that contains the PK values 
 Ex.:

 // SINGLE KEY (string)
 String id = "xxxxx";

 MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id );

 // MULTIPLE KEY (string,integer)
 String id[] = {"xxxxx", new Integer(1) };

 MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id );

Specified by:
findById in interface BeanManager<T>
Parameters:
conn - database connection
id - primary key value
Returns:
bean | null
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

find

public java.util.Collection<T> find(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                    java.util.Collection<T> result,
                                    java.lang.String where,
                                    java.lang.Object... values)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
 select beans from db using a where condition and cache the result into collection

 NB
 can close the connection before you use the collection

Specified by:
find in interface BeanManager<T>
Parameters:
conn - database connection
result - instance of collection that will contains all the instance of beans
where - condition formatted like PreparedStatement
values - Object array contains a parameters value specified into where condition
create an entry for each ? into where condition
Returns:
collection that contains all the instance of beans ( same of result parameter )
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
See Also:
java.sql.PreparedStetement

execFind

public java.util.Collection<T> execFind(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                        java.util.Collection<T> result,
                                        java.lang.Object... params)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
select beans from db using a stored procedure 
 the stored procedure must be designed for return a resultset
 and the input parameter must be only of IN type , the OUT and INOUT parameters
 are not currently supported.

 The entity name stored in BeanDescriptor object must be the name of the
 stored procedure.
NB can close the connection before you use the collection

Parameters:
conn - database connection
result - collection where append the instance of bean
params - stored procedure parameter ( only IN parameter accepted )
Returns:
the collection that contain the bean instances ( see result parameter)
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

close

protected void close(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
safe resultset close

Parameters:
rs -

close

protected void close(java.sql.Statement s)
safe statement close

Parameters:
s -
